title: Hospital Photos, Account Locked Amid Divorce: How 'Brad Pitt' Scammed Woman - NDTV
summary:
French Woman Scammed by Fake Brad Pitt for 800,000 Euros

Publication Date: Not specified Source: TF1

A French woman was deceived into believing she was in a relationship with actor Brad Pitt and lost 800,000 euros to a scammer using AI-generated images and messages.

  • The scammer contacted her on Instagram posing as Brad Pitt and his mother.
  • The victim, Anne, who was going through a divorce, was drawn in by romantic messages and declarations of love.
  • The scammer avoided voice calls while sending manipulated videos and images.
  • After Anne's divorce, the scammer claimed to need money for medical treatment, further escalating the scam.
  • The fraud was uncovered when Anne realized the deception upon seeing news about Pitt's actual relationships.
‚ÄúThere are so few men who write such things. I liked the man I was talking to and he knew how to talk to women,‚Äù said Anne.

This case highlights the dangers of online scams and the emotional vulnerability that can be exploited.
newTitle: French Woman Scammed by Fake Brad Pitt for 800,000 Euros

Dalip Tahil shares insights on the contrasting stardom journeys of Bollywood icons Shah Rukh Khan and Hrithik Roshan, emphasizing their different paths to fame.

  • In contrast, Hrithik Roshan's debut film Kaho Naa Pyar Hai catapulted him to immediate stardom.

  • Tahil reflects on his own experience working with both actors, highlighting the unique strengths each brought to their craft.
‚ÄúShah Rukh had stepping stones with these films. But Hrithik got to that stage in his first (film).‚Äù

In conclusion, the journeys of these two stars illustrate the varied paths to success in the film industry, showcasing different forms of talent and audience reception.

title: 'Game Changer' box office collection day 4: The Ram Charan starrer slows down on first Monday, expected t - TOI Etimes
summary:
Game Changer' Box Office Collection Day 4

Publication Date: January 14, 2023 | Source: Times of India

'Game Changer', released on January 10, 2023, experienced a notable drop in box office collection on its first Monday, managing to collect only Rs 7.61 crore, bringing its four-day total to Rs 96.65 crore.

  • The film had a strong opening day with Rs 52 crore but saw a decline thereafter.
  • On Sunday, the movie earned Rs 15.9 crore, marking a significant fall.
  • Monday's earnings included Rs 5.12 crore from Telugu, Rs 1.83 crore from Hindi, and Rs 66 lakh from Tamil.
  • Despite expectations to cross Rs 100 crore by day four, it fell short amid ticket price increases being retracted by the Telangana Government.
  • Upcoming releases like Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency' may impact 'Game Changer's performance.
‚ÄúThe total collection of the movie so far, in the span of 4 days, is Rs 96.65 crore.‚Äù

The future prospects for 'Game Changer' now seem uncertain with competing releases ahead and a declining trend in its box office numbers.
newTitle: Box Office Report: 'Game Changer' Slows Down on First Monday
